thyroid_tests.name: TSH (Thyroid Stimulating Hormone)
thyroid_tests.about: TSH is produced by the pituitary gland and stimulates the thyroid gland to produce thyroid hormones.

do: Consume iodine-rich foods like fish, dairy, and eggs.
Include selenium-rich foods like Brazil nuts and sunflower seeds.
don't: Limit goitrogenic foods like raw cruciferous vegetables (e.g., cabbage, broccoli).

do: Engage in moderate-intensity cardio exercises like walking or cycling.
Include strength training to support muscle mass.
don't: Avoid high-intensity exercises if you have severe hypothyroidism.
Do not overexert yourself if you experience fatigue.

thyroid_tests.name: Free T4 (Free Thyroxine)
thyroid_tests.about: Free T4 is the unbound thyroxine in the blood, which is available to the tissues.

causes_effects.high: May indicate hyperthyroidism or thyroid hormone resistance.
causes_effects.low: May indicate hypothyroidism or pituitary gland dysfunction.

do: Ensure adequate protein intake to support hormone transport.
Maintain balanced intake of vitamins and minerals.
don't: Avoid high-fat diets that can interfere with hormone absorption.

do: Practice stress-reducing activities like yoga or tai chi.
Incorporate flexibility exercises to enhance joint mobility.
don't: Do not engage in overly strenuous activities that could stress the body.

thyroid_tests.name: Free T3 (Free Triiodothyronine)
thyroid_tests.about: Free T3 is the unbound triiodothyronine in the blood, playing a crucial role in metabolism.

causes_effects.high: May indicate hyperthyroidism or excessive thyroid hormone intake.
causes_effects.low: May indicate hypothyroidism or severe illness.

do: Include zinc-rich foods like meat, shellfish, and legumes.
Consume fruits and vegetables rich in antioxidants.
don't: Limit exposure to environmental toxins and pollutants.

do: Engage in regular aerobic exercises to boost metabolism.
Incorporate breathing exercises to improve oxygenation.
don't: Do not skip warm-up and cool-down sessions.

thyroid_tests.name: TPO Antibodies (Thyroid Peroxidase Antibodies)
thyroid_tests.about: TPO antibodies indicate an autoimmune response against thyroid peroxidase, an enzyme in the thyroid gland.

causes_effects.high: May indicate Hashimoto's thyroiditis or Graves' disease.

do: Follow an anti-inflammatory diet including omega-3 fatty acids.
Eat fermented foods to support gut health.
don't: Avoid gluten if you have Hashimoto's thyroiditis.
Limit intake of refined grains and sugars.

do: Practice gentle exercises like walking or swimming.
don't: Avoid high-impact or overly strenuous activities.
Do not ignore signs of fatigue or discomfort.
